column1: She looked for them all about the menagerie
column2: and asked all the animals if they had seen her two pretty yellow-striped lion-puppies. No one had seen them
column3: and nearly every one was sorry
column4: and had something kind to say
column5: for Juno was a favorite with many. To be sure
column7: and said it served her right for thinking that she
column9: could bring up young lions. But Juno knew she had only done as she was told
column10: so she did not mind the wolf. The monkeys cracked jokes
column12: saying they guessed she would be given another family to take care of—sea lions
column14: and she would have to live in the water to keep them in order. This had not occurred to Juno before
column15: and it made her quite uneasy.
